creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description: axe head shape; deep bowl at narrow end; two rectangular feet support wider end; dark band of sediment runs through inside bottom of bowl and exterior sides and feet
text: This elegantly fashioned, early ink stone is carved in the form of a winnowing basket, a favored shape during Tang. The artisan has cleverly carved the light-grained stone to reveal a dark striation in the center of the well which simulates puddled ink. The small scale and fine condition suggest that this was an object made exclusively for burial.
title: Ink Stone
